title: Run of 11 Haper's and Leslie's Baseball Woodcuts
author: earlybball

posts.post_title: Run of 11 Haper's and Leslie's Baseball Woodcuts
posts.post_content:
Offered is a run of 11 Haper's and Leslie's Baseball Woodcuts from 1859 to 1885. Please contact me for pictures. Remaining lot full price = $625 but take all the remaining woodcuts just for $490

1859, October 15th - Harper’s Weekly – One of the Holy Grail additions of Harpers with 3 large and great woodcut illustrations. Large, full page Woodcut Illustration of the English Cricket 11 of England that toured the US in 1859; Double page woodcut illustration of the cricket match played between England and the USA at Hoboken;  Double page woodcut illustration of the Base-Ball Match a Elysian Fields, Hoboken. (whole publication in pristine condition) - $125

Sold  - 1865, August 26th - Leslie’s Illustrated – Championship Match Woodcut Illustration between the Atlantics and Mutual Clubs  -  Sold

1865, November 18th – Harper’s Weekly – Woodcut Illustration of a match played between the Athletics and the Atlantics (whole publication in good shape – no issues with the print) - $60

1865, November 25th – Harper’s Weekly – Woodcut Illustrated Portraits of the Champion Nine of the Atlantic Base-Ball Club (whole publication in great shape) - $60

1866, November 3rd – Harper’s Weekly – Woodcut Illustration of the Athletics of Philadelphia and the Atlantics of Brooklyn (chipping and a few minor tares that do not go into the portrait areas) - $60

1867, October 26th – Harper’s Weekly – Woodcut Illustration of the Champion Nine of the Union Base-Ball Club of Morrisania (whole publication in great shape) - $60

1868, May 16th – Harper’s Weekly – Woodcut Illustration of George F. Sands, President of the National Base-Ball Association - $20

1874, June 27th – Harper’s Weekly – Woodcut Illustration of the Boston Champion Base-Ball Club (whole publication – first page detached – baseball illustration with a 2 inch tare at the top- does not affect the players) $60

1882, September 30th – Harper’s Weekly – Woodcut Illustration of The Providence Base-Ball Club including: Harry Wright, George Wright, Charles “Old Hoss” Radbourn, and John Ward. (whole but detached publication) - $60

1882, October 14th – Harper’s Weekly – Illustration of the Chicago Base-Ball Club including: Cap Anson and Mike King Kelly to name a few. (whole but detached publication with 2 rips going just into the baseball image) - $50

1885, May 16th – Harper’s Weekly – Illustrated Portraits of 12 Champion Base-Ball Players including: Charles “Old Hoss” Radbourn, William Ewing, George Gore, Mike Kelly, James O’Rourke and John Ward to name a few. (whole publication in great shape) - $70
